nobasd.description: Indicates that no bias correction was performed on the climate data (e.g. ocean data).

localbc.description: Refers to local data from weather stations used for the bias-correction in e.g. the forest sector.

w5e5.description: Refers to W5E5 data used for the bias-correction globally on a 0.5° grid.

default.description: For all experiments other than the sensitivity experiments.

1901co2.description: CO₂ concentration fixed at 1901 levels as a deviation from the “obsclim” climate + CO₂ forcing.

nowatermgt.description: No water management (e.g. no human water abstraction) while other direct human forcings such as land use changes are considered according to histsoc or 2015soc.

comment.ISIMIP3a: Meinshausen et al. (2011) for 1765-2005 and Dlugokencky & Tans (2019) from 2006-2018
comment.ISIMIP3b: Meinshausen, Raper, & Wigley (2011) for 1765-2005 and 2016-2500 and Dlugokencky & Tans (2019) from 2006-2015

hyytiala.title: Hyytiälä
hyytiala.comment: Note that an experimental plot of pine contains a lot of data while footprint of flux tower is larger. Please note that the deciduous admixtures only appear in the data at a later stage and hence do not need to be simulated. Only simulate pine and spruce (no hard-woods) and regenerate as pure pine stand

peitz.title: Peitz
peitz.comment: Managed using a weak thinning from below.

kroof.title: Kranzberg Roof Project
kroof.comment: Unmanaged/ thinning from below in past 20 years for all species.

1860soc.description: Fixed year-1860 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input).
1860soc.description_note: Please label your simulations `1860soc` if they do not at all account for historical changes in direct human forcing, but they do represent constant year-1860 levels of direct human forcing for at least some direct human forcings.

1850soc.description: Fixed year-1850 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
1850soc.description_note: Please label your simulations `1850soc` if they do not at all account for historical changes in direct human forcing, but they do represent constant year-1850 levels of direct human forcing for at least some direct human forcings.

histsoc.description: Varying direct human influences in the historical period (1860-2014) (e.g. observed changes in historical land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
histsoc.description_note: Please label your model run `histsoc` **even if** it only partly accounts for varying direct human forcings while another part of the the direct human forcing is considered constant or is ignored.

2015soc.description: Fixed year-2015 direct human influences (e.g. land use, nitrogen deposition and fertilizer input, fishing effort).
2015soc.description_note: Please label your simulations `2015soc` if they do not at all account for historical changes in direct human forcing, but they do represent constant year-2015 levels of direct human forcing for at least some direct human forcings.

nat.description_note: Please only label your model run `nat` if it does not at all account for any direct human forcings, including e.g. human land use.

qtot.title: Runoff

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

qtot.comment: Total (surface + subsurface) runoff (qtot = qs + qsb). Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.

qs.title: Surface runoff

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

qs.comment: Water that leaves the surface layer (top soil layer) e.g. as overland flow / fast runoff.

qsb.title: Subsurface runoff
qsb.comment: Sum of water that flows out from subsurface layer(s) including the groundwater layer (if present). Equals qg in case of a groundwater layer below only one soil layer.

qr.title: Groundwater recharge

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

qr.comment: Water that percolates through the soil layer(s) into the groundwater layer. In case seepage is simulated but no groundwater layer is present, report seepage as qr and qg.

qg.title: Groundwater runoff
qg.comment: Water that leaves the groundwater layer. In case seepage is simulated but no groundwater layer is present, report seepage as qr and qg.

dis.title: Discharge

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

dis.comment: River discharge or streamflow. Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.

evap.title: Evapotranspiration

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

evap.comment: Sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation.

potevap.title: Potential Evapotranspiration

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

potevap.comment: As evap, but with all resistances set to zero, except the aerodynamic resistance.

soilmoist.title: Soil moisture for each layer

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

soilmoist.comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

rootmoist.title: Soil moisture, root zone

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

rootmoist.comment: Total simulated soil moisture available for evapotranspiration. Please indicate the depth of the root zone for each vegetation type in your model. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

soilmoistfroz.title: Frozen soil moisture for each layer
soilmoistfroz.comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth levels and indicate depth in m.

tsl.title: Temperature of Soil
tsl.comment: Temperature of each soil layer. Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea". This is the most important variable for the permafrost sector. If daily resolution not possible, please provide monthly. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

snd.title: Snow depth
snd.comment: Grid cell mean depth of snowpack. This variable only for the purposes of the permafrost sector.

swe.title: Snow water equivalent

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

swe.comment: Total water mass of the snowpack (liquid or frozen) averaged over grid cell. Please also deliver for the permafrost sector.

tws.title: Total water storage
tws.comment: Mean monthly water storage in all compartments. Please indicate in the netcdf metadata which storage compartments are considered.

canopystor.title: Canopy water storage
canopystor.comment: Mean monthly water storage in the canopy.

glacierstor.title: Glacier storage
glacierstor.comment: Mean monthly water storage in glaciers.

groundwstor.title: Groundwater storage
groundwstor.comment: Mean monthly water storage in groundwater layer.

lakestor.title: Lake storage
lakestor.comment: Mean monthly water storage in lakes (except reservoirs).

wetlandstor.title: Wetland storage
wetlandstor.comment: Mean monthly water storage in wetlands.

riverstor.title: Reservoir storage
riverstor.comment: Mean monthly water storage in reservoirs.

triver.title: River temperature
triver.comment: Mean monthly water temperature in river (representative of the average temperature across the channel volume).

pirrww.title: Potential irrigation water withdrawal (assuming unlimited water supply)

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

pirrww.comment: Irrigation water withdrawn in case of optimal irrigation (in addition to rainfall), assuming no losses in conveyance and application.

airrww.title: Actual irrigation water withdrawal

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

airrww.comment: Irrigation water withdrawal, taking water availability into account; please provide if computed.

pirruse.title: Potential irrigation water consumption

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

pirruse.comment: Portion of withdrawal that is evapo-transpired, assuming unlimited water supply.

airruse.title: Actual irrigation water consumption

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

airruse.comment: Portion of withdrawal that is evapo-transpired, taking water availability into account; if computed.

airrusegreen.title: Actual green water consumption on irrigated cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

airrusegreen.comment: Actual evapotranspiration from rainwater over irrigated cropland; if computed.

pirrusegreen.title: Potential green water consumption on irrigated cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

pirrusegreen.comment: Potential evapotranspiration from rainwater over irrigated cropland; if computed and different from AIrrUseGreen.

arainfusegreen.title: Actual green water consumption on rainfed cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

arainfusegreen.comment: Actual evapotranspiration from rainwater over rainfed cropland; if computed.

atotuse.title: Total (all sectors) actual water consumption
atotuse.comment: Sum of actual water consumption from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.

ptotww.title: Total (all sectors) potential water withdrawal
ptotww.comment: Sum of potential (i.e. assuming unlimited water supply) water withdrawal from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.

ptotuse.title: Total (all sectors) potential water consumption
ptotuse.comment: Sum of potential (i.e. assuming unlimited water supply) water consumption from all sectors. Please indicate in metadata which sectors are included.

soil.title: Soil types
soil.comment: Soil types or texture classes as used by your model. Please include a description of each type or class, especially if these are different from the standard HSWD and GSWP3 soil types. Please also include a description of the parameters and values associated with these soil types (parameter values could be submitted as spatial fields where appropriate).

yield.title: Crop yields
yield.unit: dry matter (t ha-1 per growing season)
yield.comment: Crop-specific: Yield may be identical to above-ground biomass (biom) if the entire plant is harvested, e.g. for bioenergy production.

aet.title: Actual evapotranspiration
aet.comment: Portion of all water (including rain) that is evapo-transpired, the water amount should be accumulated over the entire growing period (not the calendar year)

initr.title: Nitrogen application rate
initr.comment: Total nitrogen application rate. If organic and inorganic amendments are applied, rate should be reported as effective inorganic nitrogen input (ignoring residues).

plantyear.title: Actual planting year
plantyear.comment: This allows for clear identification of planting that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project

anthday.title: Anthesis dates
anthday.comment: Together with the year of anthesis added to the list of outputs (see below) it allows for clear identification of anthesis that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.

anthyear.title: Year of anthesis
anthyear.comment: It allows for clear identification of anthesis that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.

matyday.title: Maturity dates
matyday.comment: Together with the year of maturity added to the list of outputs (see below) it allows for clear identification of maturity that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.

matyyear.title: Year of maturity
matyyear.comment: It allows for clear identification of maturity that is also easy to follow for potential users from outside the project.

biom.title: Above ground biomass (dry matter)
biom.comment: The whole plant biomass above ground.

sco2.title: Soil carbon emissions
sco2.comment: Ideally should be modeled with realistic land-use history and initial carbon pools. Subject to extra study.

sn2o.title: Nitrous oxide emissions
sn2o.comment: Ideally should be modeled with realistic land-use history and initial carbon pools. Subject to extra study.

tnup.title: Total N uptake (total growing season sum)

tnin.title: Total N inputs (total growing season sum)

tnloss.title: Total N losses (total growing season sum)

gsprcp.title: Growing season precipitation
gsprcp.comment: Total growing season precipitation per crop

gsrsds.title: Growing season radiation
gsrsds.comment: Average growing season shortwave solar radiation

sumt.title: Growing season temperature sum
sumt.comment: Sum of daily mean temperature over growing season

amphibianprob.title: Amphibian species probability of occurrence
amphibianprob.comment: Results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

birdprob.title: Terrestrial bird species probability of occurrence
birdprob.comment: Results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

mammalprob.title: Terrestrial mammal species probability of occurrence
mammalprob.comment: Results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

amphibiansumprob.title: Amphibian summed probability of occurrence
amphibiansumprob.unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
amphibiansumprob.comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

birdsumprob.title: Terrestrial bird summed probability of occurrence
birdsumprob.unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
birdsumprob.comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

mammalsumprob.title: Terrestrial mammal summed probability of occurrence
mammalsumprob.unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
mammalsumprob.comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

endamphibiansumprob.title: Summed probability of endemic amphibian species
endamphibiansumprob.unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
endamphibiansumprob.comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

endbirdsumprob.title: Summed probability of endemic terrestrial bird species
endbirdsumprob.unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
endbirdsumprob.comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

endmammalsumprob.title: Summed probability of endemic terrestrial mammal species
endmammalsumprob.unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
endmammalsumprob.comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

thramphibiansumprob.title: Summed probability of threatened amphibian species
thramphibiansumprob.unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
thramphibiansumprob.comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

thrbirdsumprob.title: Summed probability of threatened terrestrial bird species
thrbirdsumprob.unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
thrbirdsumprob.comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

thrmammalsumprob.title: Summed probability of threatened terrestrial mammal species
thrmammalsumprob.unit: Summed probability of occurrence per cell
thrmammalsumprob.comment: Aggregated results from individual SDMs assuming no dispersal.

amphibiansr.title: Amphibian species richness
amphibiansr.unit: Estimated number of species (species richness) per cell

birdsr.title: Terrestrial bird species richness
birdsr.unit: Estimated number of species (species richness) per cell

mammalsr.title: Terrestrial mammal species richness
mammalsr.unit: Estimated number of species (species richness) per cell

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

cvegag.title: Carbon Mass in aboveground vegetation biomass

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

cvegbg.title: Carbon Mass in belowground vegetation biomass

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon*m-2, Info for each individual pool.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.biomes: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.forestry: As kg carbon*m-2, Info for each individual soil layer.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

cproduct.title: Carbon in Products of Land Use Change

comment.biomes: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

charv.title: Carbon in biomass harvested from natural vegetation

comment.biomes: Refers to Carbon not going into soil. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

gpp.title: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land

ra.title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land

npp.title: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Primary Production on Land

nppleaf.title: Net Primary Production on Land allocated to leaf biomass

npproot.title: Net Primary Production on Land allocated to fine root biomass

nppagwood.title: Net Primary Production on Land allocated to above ground woody biomass

nppbgwood.title: Net Primary Production on Land allocated to below ground wood biomass

rh.title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land

fireint.title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to CO₂ Emission from Fire

burntarea.title: Burnt Area Fraction
burntarea.comment: Fire should be only allowed to burn natural vegetation, rangelands and managed pastures but not croplands. Area percentage of grid cell that has burned at any time of the given day/month/year (for daily/monthly/annual resolution)

ecoatmflux.title: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land
ecoatmflux.comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes from fire, harvest, grazing and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.

fapar.title: Fraction of absorbed photosynthetically active radiation

comment.water_global: If used by, or computed by the model.

pft.title: Plant Functional Type Grid Fraction
pft.comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their PFT definitions. This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc. Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid cell that is land.

intercep.title: Evaporation from Canopy (interception)
intercep.comment: The canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).

hei.title: Stand Height
hei.comment: For models including natural regeneration this variable may not make sense, please report domhei.

domhei.title: Dominant Height
domhei.comment: Mean height of the 100 highest trees per hectare.

harv.title: Harvest by DBH-class
harv.comment: DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

stemno.title: Remaining stem number after disturbance and management by dbh class
stemno.comment: DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

age.title: Tree age by dbh class
age.comment: DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

mortstemno.title: Removed stem numbers by DBH class by natural mortality
mortstemno.comment: As trees per hectare. DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

harvstemno.title: Removed stem numbers by DBH class by management
harvstemno.comment: As trees per hectare. DBH class resolution: Either DBH classes or total per species

strat.title: Thermal stratification
strat.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
strat.comment: 1 if lake grid cell is thermally stratified, 0 if lake grid cell is not thermally stratified

thermodepth.title: Depth of Thermocline
thermodepth.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
thermodepth.comment: Depth corresponding the maximum water density gradient

watertemp.title: Water temperature
watertemp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
watertemp.comment: Depth resolution: Full Profile. Simulated water temperature. Layer averages and full profiles.

surftemp.title: Surface temperature
surftemp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
surftemp.comment: Average of the upper layer in case not simulated directly.

bottemp.title: Bottom temperature
bottemp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
bottemp.comment: Average of the lowest layer in case not simulated directly.

ice.title: Lake ice cover
ice.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
ice.comment: 1 if ice cover is present in lake grid cell, 0 if no ice cover is present in lake grid cell

lakeicefrac.title: Lake layer ice mass fraction
lakeicefrac.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
lakeicefrac.comment: Depth resolution: Mean epi. Fraction of mass of a given layer taken up by ice.

icethick.title: Ice thickness
icethick.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

snowthick.title: Snow thickness
snowthick.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

icetemp.title: Temperature at the ice upper surface
icetemp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

snowtemp.title: Temperature at the snow upper surface
snowtemp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell

sensheatf.title: Sensible heat flux at the lake-atmosphere interface
sensheatf.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
sensheatf.comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards.

latentheatf.title: Latent heat flux at the lake-atmosphere interface
latentheatf.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
latentheatf.comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards.

momf.title: Momentum flux at the lake-atmosphere interface
momf.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
momf.comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards.

swup.title: Upward shortwave radiation flux at the lake-atmosphere interface
swup.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
swup.comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards. Not to be confused with net shortwave radiation.

lwup.title: Upward longwave radiation flux at the lake-atmosphere interface
lwup.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
lwup.comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards. Not to be confused with net longwave radiation.

lakeheatf.title: Downward heat flux at the lake-atmosphere interface
lakeheatf.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
lakeheatf.comment: At the surface of snow, ice or water depending on the layer in contact with the atmosphere. Positive if upwards. the residual term of the surface energy balance, i.e. the net amount of energy that enters the lake on daily time scale: lakeheatf = swdown - swup + lwdown - lwup - sensheatf - latenheatf (terms defined positive when directed upwards)

turbdiffheat.title: Turbulent diffusivity of heat
turbdiffheat.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
turbdiffheat.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Only if computed by the model.

albedo.title: Surface albedo
albedo.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
albedo.comment: Albedo of the surface interacting with the atmosphere (water, ice or snow).

extcoeff.title: Light extinction coefficient
extcoeff.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
extcoeff.comment: Only to be reported for global models, local models should use extcoeff as input.

sedheatf.title: Sediment upward heat flux at the lake-sediment interface
sedheatf.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
sedheatf.comment: Positive if upwards. Only if computed by the model.

chl.title: Chlorophyll Concentration
chl.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
chl.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Total water chlorophyll concentration – indicator of phytoplankton.

phytobio.title: Phytoplankton Functional group biomass
phytobio.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
phytobio.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Different models will have different numbers of functional groups so that the reporting of these will vary by model.

zoobio.title: Phytoplankton Functional group biomass
zoobio.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
zoobio.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Total simulated Zooplankton biomass.

tp.title: Total Phosphorus
tp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
tp.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.

pp.title: Particulate Phosphorus
pp.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
pp.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.

tpd.title: Total Dissolved Phosphorus
tpd.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
tpd.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Some models may also output data for soluble reactive phosphorus (SRP).

tn.title: Total Nitrogen
tn.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
tn.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.

pn.title: Particulate Nitrogen
pn.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
pn.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.

tdn.title: Total Dissolved Nitrogen
tdn.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
tdn.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Some models may also output data for Nitrate (N02) nitrite (NO3) and ammonium (NH4).

do.title: Dissolved Oxygen
do.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
do.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo.

doc.title: Dissolved Organic Carbon
doc.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
doc.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Not always available.

si.title: Dissolved Silica
si.resolution: Representative lake associated with grid cell
si.comment: Depth resolution: Either full profile, or mean epi and mean hypo. Not always available.

tcb.title: TOTAL consumer biomass density
tcb.comment: all consumers (trophic level >1, vertebrates and invertebrates)

b10cm.title: Biomass density of consumers >10cm
b10cm.comment: if L infinity is >10 cm, include in >10 cm class

b30cm.title: Biomass density of consumers >30cm
b30cm.comment: if L infinity is >30 cm, include in >30 cm class

tc.title: TOTAL Catch (all commercial functional groups / size classes)
tc.comment: catch at sea (commercial landings plus discards, fish and invertebrates)

tla.title: TOTAL Landings (all commercial functional groups / size classes)
tla.comment: commercial landings (catch without discards, fish and invertebrates)

bcom.title: Biomass density of commercial species
bcom.comment: Discarded species not included (Fish and invertebrates)

blarge.title: Biomass density of large consumers >90cm and <100kg

bmed.title: Biomass density of medium consumers >30cm and <90cm

b.title: Biomass density (by functional group / size class)
b.comment: Provide name of each size class (<class>) and functional group (<group>) used, and provide a definition of each class/group.

c.title: Catch (by functional group / size class)
c.comment: Provide name of each size class (<class>) and functional group (<group>) used, and provide a definition of each class/group.

ancold.title: Number of deaths attributable to cold
ancold.comment: For ERF models, this occurs when temperature is below threshold (e.g., minimum mortality temperature (MMT)). Report 0 if temperature above threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

anheat.title: Number of deaths attributable to heat
anheat.comment: Temperature above threshold (ERFs). Report 0 if temperature below threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

btm.title: Baseline total mortality
btm.comment: To be reported as annual series of mean daily total mortality, or as a single number of mean daily mortality; to be used for computations of attributable fractions. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

pop.title: Population
pop.comment: Baseline population data should be provided for computations of mortality rates (i.e. deaths per total population). See Section ‎5.1.6. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.

expc.title: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon

intpp.title: Primary Organic Carbon Production by All Types of Phytoplankton

intppdiat.title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms

intppdiaz.title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Diazotrophs

intpppico.title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Picophytoplankton

intppmisc.title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton

phydiat.title: Mole Concentration of Diatoms expressed as Carbon in sea water

phydiaz.title: Mole Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phypico.title: Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water

phymisc.title: Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton expressed as Carbon in sea water

pp.title: Primary Carbon Production by Total Phytoplankton

zmeso.title: Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton expressed as Carbon in sea water

zmicro.title: Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton expressed as Carbon in sea water

default.title: Default
default.description: Model should use their individual “best representation” of the historical period with regard to sowing dates, harvesting dates, fertilizer application rates and crop varieties.

fullharm.title: Fully harmonized
fullharm.description: Simulations based on prescribed “present day” fertilization rates (available for download) and fixed planting and harvesting dates (also available for download). Modelers should have planting as closely as possible to these dates, but it may be admissible to use these dates as indicators for planting windows (depending on model specifics).

harmnon.title: Harmonized seasons with no N constraints
harmnon.description: For models with an explicit description of the nitrogen cycle: harmnon simulations should be run with nitrogen stress turned off completely or (if that’s not possible) with very high N application rates to make model results comparable between those GGCMs that have explicit N dynamics and those that do not. For models without the nitrogen cycle: harmnon and fullharm simulations are the same and do not need to be duplicated.

obsclim.description: Observed climate and CO₂ forcing used for model evaluation and the detection and attribution task.

spinclim.description: Detrended version of the observed climate forcing used to spin-up the simulations based on a stable 1900 climate (see explanation below for details regarding the design of the spin-up)

counterclim.description: Detrended version of the observed climate forcing used for the "no climate change" baseline simulations in the context of the detection and attributions task.

picontrol.description: Pre-industrial climate as simulated by the GCMs.

historical.description: Historical climate as simulated by the GCMs.

ssp126.description: SSP1-RCP2.6 climate as simulated by the GCMs.

ssp585.description: SSP5-RCP8.5 climate as simulated by the GCMs.

gswp3_hwsd.comment: One fixed pattern to be used for all simulation periods. Upscaled Soil texture map (30 arc sec. to 0.5°x0.5° grid) based on Harmonized World Soil Database v1.1 (HWSD) using the GSWP3 upscaling method A (<http://hydro.iis.u-tokyo.ac.jp/~sujan/research/gswp3/soil-texture-map.html>)

basins.comment: DDM30 (Döll & Lehner, 2002). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

flowdir.comment: DDM30 (Döll & Lehner, 2002). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

slopes.comment: DDM30 (Döll & Lehner, 2002). Documentation (pdf) is provided alongside data files.

variables: percentage of lakes in grid cell (pct_lake)
pctlake.comment: For these variables, new forcing files will be provided soon: histsoc, accounting for reservoir expansion; and 2015soc.

variables: total lake surface area in grid cell (tot_area)
average surface area of lakes in grid cell (avg_area)

lakedepth.comment: For these variables, new forcing files will be provided soon: histsoc, accounting for reservoir expansion; and 2015soc.

description.climate: No climate change before 1860, observed forcing afterwards; constant 1860 levels of CO₂ before 1860 and based on observations afterwards
description.soc: Fixed 1860 levels of direct human forcing before 1860, varying direct human influences according to observations afterwards

description.climate: No climate change before 1901, observed forcing afterwards; constant 1860 levels of CO2 before 1860 and based on observations afterwards
description.soc: Fixed 2015 levels of direct human forcing for the entire time period

description.climate: No climate change before 1901, observed forcing afterwards; 1860 levels of CO₂ before 1860 and based on observations afterwards
description.soc: No direct human influences

counterfactual-histsoc.title: counterfactual climate
counterfactual-histsoc.subtitle: histsoc

description.climate: de-trended observational climate forcing (counterfactual "no climate change" situation) + fixed CO₂ concentration at 1901 level
description.soc: 1860 levels of direct human forcing before 1860, varying direct human influences according to observations afterwards

counterfactual-histsoc.spin_up: "histsoc" version of the transition period of the model evaluation run

counterfactual-2015soc.title: counterfactual climate
counterfactual-2015soc.subtitle: 2015soc

description.climate: de-trended observational climate forcing (counterfactual "no climate change" situation)
description.soc: fixed 2015 levels of direct human influences for the entire time period

counterfactual-2015soc.spin_up: "2015soc" version of the transition period of the model evaluation run

counterfactual-nat.title: counterfactual climate
counterfactual-nat.subtitle: nat

description.climate: de-trended observational climate forcing (counterfactual "no climate change" situation) + fixed CO₂ concentration at 1901 level
description.soc: No direct human influences

counterfactual-nat.spin_up: "nat" version of the transition period of the model evaluation run

co2sensitivity-histsoc.title: CO₂ sensitivity
co2sensitivity-histsoc.subtitle: histsoc

description.climate: no climate change before 1901, observed forcing afterwards + fixed CO₂ concentration at 1901 level
description.soc: 1860 levels of direct human forcing before 1860, varying direct human influences according to observations afterwards

co2sensitivity-histsoc.spin_up: "histsoc" version of the transition period of the model evaluation run

co2sensitivity-2015soc.title: CO₂ sensitivity
co2sensitivity-2015soc.subtitle: 2015soc

description.climate: no climate change before 1901, observed forcing afterwards + fixed CO₂ concentration at 1901 level
description.soc: fixed 2015 levels of direct human influences for the entire time period

co2sensitivity-2015soc.spin_up: "2015soc" version of the transition period of the model evaluation run

nowatermgt-histsoc.title: Water management sensitivity
nowatermgt-histsoc.subtitle: histsoc

description.climate: no climate change before 1901, observed forcing afterwards + fixed CO₂ concentration at 1901 level
description.soc: no accounting for water management but representation of other direct human influences such as land use changes according to "histsoc"

nowatermgt-histsoc.spin_up: "histsoc" version of the transition period of the model evaluation run

nowatermgt-2015soc.title: Water management sensitivity
nowatermgt-2015soc.subtitle: 2015soc

description.climate: no climate change before 1901, observed forcing afterwards + fixed CO₂ concentration at 1901 level
description.soc: no accounting for water management but representation of other direct human influences such as land use patterns according to "2015soc"

nowatermgt-2015soc.spin_up: "2015soc" version of the transition period of the model evaluation run

description.climate: no climate change, pre-industrial CO₂ fixed at 1850 levels
description.soc: varying management before 2015, then fixed at 2015 levels thereafter

description.climate: no climate change, pre-industrial CO₂ fixed at 1850 levels
description.soc: fixed at 2015 levels for all periods

description.climate: no climate change, pre-industrial CO₂ fixed at 1850 levels
description.soc: No direct human influences

rcp26-histsoc.title: RCP2.6
rcp26-histsoc.subtitle: histsoc

description.climate: Simulated historical climate and CO₂ in historical period, then SSP1-RCP2.6 climate & CO₂
description.soc: varying management before 2015, then fixed at 2015 levels thereafter

rcp26-histsoc.pre_industrial: "histsoc" version of the pre-industrial period of the pre-industrial control experiment

rcp26-2015soc.title: RCP2.6
rcp26-2015soc.subtitle: 2015soc

description.climate: Simulated historical climate and CO₂ in historical period, then SSP1-RCP2.6 climate & CO₂
description.soc: fixed at 2015 levels for all periods

rcp26-2015soc.pre_industrial: "2015soc" version of the pre-industrial period of the pre-industrial control experiment

rcp26-nat.title: RCP2.6
rcp26-nat.subtitle: nat

description.climate: Simulated historical climate and CO₂ in historical period, then SSP1-RCP2.6 climate & CO₂
description.soc: No direct human influences

rcp26-nat.pre_industrial: "nat" version of the pre-industrial period of the pre-industrial control experiment

co2sensitivity-rcp26-histsoc.title: CO₂ sensitivity RCP2.6
co2sensitivity-rcp26-histsoc.subtitle: histsoc

description.climate: RCP2.6 climate, CO2 after 2015 fixed at 2015 levels
description.soc: varying management before 2015, then fixed at 2015 levels thereafter

co2sensitivity-rcp26-histsoc.pre_industrial: "histsoc" version of the pre-industrial period of the pre-industrial control experiment
co2sensitivity-rcp26-histsoc.historical: "histsoc" version of the historical period of the RCP2.6 experiment, as described above

rcp85-histsoc.title: RCP8.5
rcp85-histsoc.subtitle: histsoc

description.climate: SSP5-RCP8.5 climate & CO₂
description.soc: varying management before 2015, then fixed at 2015 levels thereafter

rcp85-histsoc.pre_industrial: "histsoc" version of pre-industrial of pre-industrial control experiment runs
rcp85-histsoc.historical: "histsoc" version of the historical period of the RCP2.6 experiment

rcp85-2015soc.subtitle: 2015soc

description.climate: SSP5-RCP8.5 climate & CO₂
description.soc: fixed at 2015 levels for all periods

rcp85-2015soc.pre_industrial: "2015soc" version of pre-industrial of pre-industrial control experiment runs
rcp85-2015soc.historical: "2015soc" version of the historical period of the RCP2.6 experiment

rcp85-nat.subtitle: nat

description.soc: No direct human influences

description.soc: varying management before 2015, then fixed at 2015 levels thereafter

co2sensitivity-rcp85-histsoc.historical: "histsoc" version of the historical period of the RCP2.6 experiment

co2sensitivity-rcp85-nat.subtitle: nat

co2sensitivity-rcp85-nat.historical: "nat" version of the historical period of the RCP2.6 experiment

landuse-totals.title: Landuse totals
variables: share of managed pastures or rangeland (pastures)
landuse-totals.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set (Klein Goldewijk, 2016), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, & et al, in prep., see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

landuse-5crops.title: Downscaling to 5 crops
variables: share of rainfed/irrigated C4 annual crops (c4ann_rainfed, c4ann_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C3 perennial crops (c3per_rainfed, c3per_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C3 N-fixing crops (c3nfx_rainfed, c3nfx_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C4 annual crops (c4ann_rainfed, c4ann_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C4 perennial crops (c4per_rainfed, c4per_irrigated)
landuse-5crops.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set (Klein Goldewijk, 2016), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, & et al, in prep., see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

landuse-15crops.title: Downscaling to 15 crops
variables: share of rainfed/irrigated oil crops (groundnut) (oil_crops_groundnut_rainfed, oil_crops_groundnut_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated oil crops (rapeseed) (oil_crops_rapeseed_rainfed, oil_crops_rapeseed_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated oil crops (soybean) (oil_crops_soybean_rainfed, oil_crops_soybean_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated oil crops (sunflower) (oil_crops_sunflower_rainfed, oil_crops_sunflower_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated temperate cereals (temperate_cereals_rainfed, temperate_cereals_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated temperate roots (temperate_roots_rainfed, temperate_roots_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated tropical cereals (tropical_cereals_rainfed, tropical_cereals_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated tropical roots (tropical_roots_rainfed, tropical_roots_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C3 annual crops not covered by the above (others_c3ann_rainfed, others_c3ann_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C3 N-fixing crops not covered by the above (others_c3nfx_rainfed, others_c3nfx_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C3 perennial crops (c3per_rainfed, c3per_irrigated)
share of rainfed/irrigated C4 perennial crops (c4per_rainfed, c4per_irrigated)
share of pastures, both managed and rangeland (pastures)
landuse-15crops.comment: The C4 perennial crops are not further downscaled from the "5 crops" data set and currently only include sugarcane.  Similarly, the C3 perennial crops are not downscaled either. The data is derived from the "5 crops" LUH2 data, and the crops have been downscaled to 15 crops according to the ratios given by the Monfreda data set (Monfreda, Ramankutty, & Foley, 2008).

landuse-pastures.title: Managed pastures and rangeland
landuse-pastures.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set (Klein Goldewijk, 2016), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, & et al, in prep., see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

landuse-urbanareas.title: Urban areas
landuse-urbanareas.comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set (Klein Goldewijk, 2016), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, & et al, in prep., see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

n-fertilizer-5crops.title: Nitrogen deposited by fertilizers on croplands
variables: deposition of N through fertilizer on cropland with C3 annual crops (fertl_c3ann)
n-fertilizer-5crops.comment: Based on the LUH2 v2h data set (see Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, & et al, in prep., see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

ndep_nhx.title: Reduced nitrogen deposition
ndep_nhx.comment: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) during 1860-2014. Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. Data in 2015 and 2016 is assumed to be same as that in 2014 (Tian et al. 2018)

ndep_noy.title: Oxidized nitrogen deposition
ndep_noy.comment: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) during 1860-2014.  Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. Data in 2015 and 2016 is assumed to be same as that in 2014 (Tian et al. 2018)

reservoirs_dams.title: Reservoirs & dams
variables: Unique ID representing a dam and its associated reservoir corresponding to GRanD/KSU IDs (ID)
location adjusted to the DDM30 routing network (LON_DDM30, LAT_DDM30)
alternative year may indicate a multi-year construction or secondary dam (ALT_YEAR)
flag of correction if relocation was applied (FLAG_CORR)
river name which the dam impounds (RIVER)
reservoirs_dams.comment: Lehner et al. (2011a, <https://doi.org/10.7927/H4N877QK>), Lehner et al. (2011b, <https://dx.doi.org/10.1890/100125>). Because the data from KSU is yet unpublished, modeling teams using it are asked to offer co-authorship to the team at KSU on any resulting publications. Please contact <info@isimip.org> in case of questions.

water_abstraction.title: Water abstraction for domestic and industrial purposes
variables: domestic and industrial water withdrawal and consumption (domww, domwc, indww, indwc)
water_abstraction.comment: For modelling groups that do not have their own representation, we provide files containing the multi-model mean of domestic and industrial water withdrawal and consumption generated by WaterGAP, PCR-GLOBWB, and H08. This data is based ISIMIP2a varsoc simulations for 1901-2005, and on RCP6.0 simulations from the Water Futures and Solutions project (Wada et al., 2016, <http://www.geosci-model-dev.net/9/175/2016/>) for after 2005. Years before 1901 have been filled with the value for year 1901.

fishing_effort.title: Fishing effort
fishing_effort.file_note: Please contact the sectoral coordinators of the marine ecosystems and fisheries sector to gain access to this data.
fishing_effort.resolution: Marine ecosystems or exclusive economic zones
fishing_effort.comment: Sea Around Us Project (SAUP; <http://www.seaaroundus.org>). Data can currently not be hosted on ISIMIP servers; for access please contact the sectoral coordinators of the marine ecosystems and fisheries sector.

fishing_catch.title: Fish catch
fishing_catch.file_note: Please contact the sectoral coordinators of the marine ecosystems and fisheries sector to gain access to this data.
fishing_catch.resolution: Marine ecosystems or exclusive economic zones
fishing_catch.comment: Regional Fisheries Management Organizations (RFMOs; <https://ec.europa.eu/fisheries/cfp/international/rfmo_en>) and/or local fisheries agencies. Data can currently not be hosted on ISIMIP servers; for access please contact the sectoral coordinators of the marine ecosystems and fisheries sector.

forest_management.title: Forest management
forest_management.comment: Reyer et al. 2019a, b management prescribes stem numbers remaining after harvest, management data is annual but not every year has data.

population_5arcmin.title: Population 5' grid
population_5arcmin.comment: HYDE v3.2.1 (Klein Goldewijk et al., 2017). Decadal data prior to year 2000 have been linearly interpolated in time.

population_30arcmin.title: Population 0.5° grid
population_30arcmin.comment: HYDE v3.2.1 (Klein Goldewijk et al., 2017). Decadal data prior to year 2000 have been linearly interpolated in time. Aggregated to 0.5° spatial resolution

population_national.title: Population national
variables: total number of people per country
population_national.comment: HYDE v3.2.1 (Klein Goldewijk et al., 2017). Decadal data prior to year 1950 have been linearly interpolated in time.

gdp.title: GDP
gdp.comment: Historic country-level GDP data are an extension of the data provided by Geiger, 2018 (<https://www.earth-syst-sci-data.net/10/847/2018/essd-10-847-2018.html>), and are derived mainly from the Maddison Project database. Gridded GDP data is based on the downscaling algorithm developed by Murakami & Yamagata, 2019 (<https://www.mdpi.com/2071-1050/11/7/2106>, <http://doi.org/10.5880/pik.2017.007>). The years 2000-2016 have been rescaled to provide a better match to the updated national GDP time series.
